source.helpers¶

This module contains various helper functions and classes.

source.helpers.abc2complex(u)[source]¶

Transform three-phase quantities to a complex space vector.

Parameters

u (array_like, shape (3,)) – Phase quantities.

Returns

Complex space vector (peak-value scaling).

Return type

complex

Examples

>>> y = abc2complex([1, 2, 3])
>>> y
(-1-0.5773502691896258j)
source.helpers.complex2abc(u)[source]¶

Transform a complex space vector to three-phase quantities.

Parameters

u (complex) – Complex space vector (peak-value scaling).

Returns

Phase quantities.

Return type

ndarray, shape (3,)

Examples

>>> y = complex2abc(1-.5j)
>>> y
array([ 1.       , -0.9330127, -0.0669873])
class source.helpers.Sequence(times, values, periodic=False)[source]¶

Sequence generator.

This represents a sequence generator. The time array must be increasing. The output values are interpolated between the data points.

Parameters

  • times (ndarray) – Time values.

  • values (ndarray) – Output values.

  • periodic (Boolean, optional) – Enables periodicity. The default is False.

__call__(self, t)[source]¶

Interpolate the output.

Parameters

t (float) – Time.

Returns

Interpolated output.

Return type

float or complex

__str__(self)[source]¶

Return str(self).

Step function.

source.helpers.ref_ramp(mdl, w_max=2 * np.pi * 50, tau_max=14.6, t_max=4)[source]¶

Generate a ramp reference.

This generate an example ramp profile for the speed reference. The load torque changes stepwise.

Parameters

  • mdl (object) – Drive model.

  • w_max (float, optional) – Maximum speed in the profile. The default is 2*pi*50.

  • tau_max (float, optional) – Maximum load torque in the profile. The default is 14.6.

  • t_max (float, optional) – Length of the profile. The default is 4.

source.helpers.ref_step(mdl, w_max=0.8 * 2 * np.pi * 50, tau_max=14.6, t_max=1.5)[source]¶

Generate a step reference.

This generates an example stepwise profile for the speed reference and load torque.

Parameters

  • mdl (object) – Drive model.

  • w_max (float, optional) – Maximum speed in the profile. The default is .8*2*pi*50.

  • tau_max (float, optional) – Maximum load torque in the profile. The default is 14.6.

  • t_max (float, optional) – Length of the profile. The default is 1.5.

source.helpers.plot(mdl, ctrl, base)[source]¶

Plot example figures.

Parameters

  • mdl (object) – Continuous-time solution.

  • ctrl (object) – Continuous-time solution.

  • base (object) – Base values.

source.helpers.plot_im_extra(mdl, ctrl, base)[source]¶

Plot extra waveforms for an induction motor with a diode bridge.

Parameters

  • mdl (object) – Continuous-time solution.

  • ctrl (object) – Continuous-time solution.

  • base (object) – Base values.

source.helpers.save_plot(name)[source]¶

Save figures.

This saves figures in a folder “figures” in the current directory. If the folder doesn’t exist, it is created.

Parameters

  • name (string) – Name for the figure

  • plt (object) – Handle for the figure to be saved
